check_item: eSIF
Prepare for service

Do a check of
the warning log.
Tightening torque.
Functional safety test
Tower: Do a test of the emergency stop function from the tower.

To do a test of
the emergency stop buttons in the tower: Do the test of
the emergency stop buttons -610-02-S1 for the tower control cabinet.

Do the test of
the emergency stop buttons -610-02-S6A for the tower
top in the tower.

Do the test of
the emergency stop buttons -610-02-S6B for the tower
top in the tower.

Nacelle: Do a test to see if
the emergency stop activates the brake.
To do a test of the emergency stop buttons in the nacelle: Do the test

of
the emergency stop buttons -610-02-S3 for the yaw control cabinet.

Do the test of
the emergency stop buttons -610-02-S4 for the main
shaft (LSS).

Do the test of
the emergency stop buttons -610-02-S5 for the nacelle
control cabinet.
Do a check of the vibration sensor.

Hub and blades: To do a test of
the emergency stop buttons in the hub:

Do the test of
the emergency stop buttons -135-S1 for the hub control
cabinet.

Do the test of
the emergency stop buttons -135-S2 for the hub I/O box.
Safety equipment
Fall arrest equipment (rail): Visually examine the fall protection rail and
the ladder for dents, holes, and cracks.
Examine all the bolts on the fall protection rail.
Fall arrest equipment (wire): Examine the safety cable.
Examine the bottom bracket.

Examine the ladder,
the cable, and the cable guides.
Examine the top bracket.
Rotor
Hub: ++05 Hub control cabinet: Do a check of the heating element.
Visually check the hub control cabinet and the support brackets for
loose bolts or cracks in the brackets.
Do a test of the RCCB in the hub controller.
Replace the 12 V backup battery in the ++05 hub control cabinet.
Visually examine the 12 V batteries for leakage.

Hub cover: Do a check of
the fibreglass connections for loose bolts.
Examine the nose cone for cracks in the fibreglass around the bolted
connections.

Blade bearing: Do a check of
the blade bearing seals for leakage.
Semi-automatic lubrication system: To check the grease hoses: Do a

check of
the grease hoses for cracks and wear.

Do a check of
the grease hoses and their attachments for tightness.
Do a check of the grease distribution block assembly and its

attachment
for tightness.

Do a check of
the grease collecting cans.
Lubricate the blade bearings.
Blades: Examine the blades.

Do a check of
the blade collar.

Do an internal
inspection of
the structural shell blade.

Do a check of
the LCTU.
Hydraulic systems

Extract a sample of
the hydraulic oil.

Replace the filter element of
the return line filter.
Flush the hydraulic system after the filter change.
Gearbox and gear oil system

Extract
the gear oil sample.
Replace the filter cartridge in the air filter housing.
Replace the offline filter and the O-rings in the gearbox.

To replace the 2 inline 10 ìm gear oil
filters (filter block HG1270):

Replace the 2 inline 10 ìm gear oil
filters and the O-rings.

Visually examine all
the fittings, components on the filter block, and the
pumps for leakage.
To lubricate the main bearings: Lubricate the main bearing without an
automatic grease lubrication system.
Do a check and adjust the LSS or RPM sensors.

To examine the rotor locking pins: Do a visual
inspection of
the rotor
locking pins and the rotor lock disc holes for damage.
Lubricate the rotor locking pins.
Generator and coupling
Generator: Do a check of the bearings for unusual noise.

Do a check of
the automatic lubrication system.

Do a check to see if
the grease return pipe is blocked.

Do a check of
the lubrication pump for tightness.

Do a check of
the power slip ring system.
Measure all ground brushes:
Ground brush # 1:
Ground brush # 2
Ground brush # 3
Ground brush # 4:
Ground brush # 5:
Ground brush # 6:

Do a check of the form and function of
the ground brushes.
Identify the power brush type: Mersen
Identify the power brush type: BGB
Measure the most worn power brush:
Measurement:

Do a check of
the form and function of
the power brushes.

Identify the slip ring unit
type: Mersen

Identify the slip ring unit
type: BGB

Do a check of
the slip ring surfaces.
Do a check and measure the groove depth for the power brushes.
Power brush # 1:
Power brush # 2:
Power brush # 3:

To check the suction fan and the filter for the PSRS: Do a check of
the
suction fan, the filter, and the exhaust hose fitting.
Cooling and conditioning

To do a check of
the liquid cooling system: Do a visual
inspection of
the
circulation pump -690-02-G1 for leakage in the shaft seal.

Do a check of
the 2 hoses in the front end for incipient cracks, wear,
and leakage.
Do a check of the 2 hoses in the ILU pipe system for incipient cracks,
wear, and leakage.

Do a check of
the 5 hoses in the pump area for incipient cracks, wear,
and leakage.

Do a check of
the 2 hoses on column 3 (right-hand side) for incipient
cracks, wear, and leakage.
Do a check of the 3 hoses for the roof section for incipient cracks,
wear, and leakage.

Do a check of
the 2 hoses in the rear end for incipient cracks, wear,
and leakage.

CoolerTop®: Do a check of
the CoolerTop® ladder for loose or missing
bolts.
Visually examine the fibreglass for cracks along the leading edge.
Visually examine the cooler elements on the CoolerTop® for damage
through the skylight.
Nacelle
Safety functions: Examine the parking brake.

Do a test of
the shock sensor.

Nacelle controller cabinets: To do a check of
the ++03 CON A

controller section: Do a test of
the heating element.
Do a test of the safety system batteries.

Do a check of
the fan and the air filters.

To do a check of
the ++53 CON B controller section: Do a test of
the
heating element.

Do a check of
the fan and the air filters.
Replace the safety system batteries.

To do a check of
the ++04++3 busbar cabinet: Do a test of
the heating
element.

Do a check of
the fan and the air filters.
Do a test of the main circuit breakers (-405-04-F1, -400-04-F1, and

To do a check of the ++04++1 VCS converter cabinet: Do a test of
the
heating element.
Do a check of the air filter.

Rotating transfer unit: To do a check of
the slip ring unit (BGB): Visually

examine the slip ring unit
for burns and excessive dust.

Do a visual check of
the brushes for burns and wear.

To do a check of
the slip ring unit (REKOFA): Visually examine the slip

ring unit
for burns and excessive dust.

Do a visual check of
the brushes for burns and wear.
Wind sensor: Clean the wind sensor.
Visually examine the cables for damage and wear.

Examine all
the wind sensor equipment,
the brackets, and the masts
for severe damage.
Do a check of all the wind sensor equipment, the brackets, and the
masts for tightness.
Yaw system
Yaw bearing system: Measure the radial backlash.
Claw beam number 1: CW end:
Claw beam number 1: CCW end:
Claw beam number 2: CW end:
Claw beam number 2: CCW end:
Claw beam number 3: CW end:
Claw beam number 3: CCW end:
Claw beam number 4: CW end:
Claw beam number 4: CCW end:
Claw beam number 5: CW end:
Claw beam number 5: CCW end:
Claw beam number 6: CW end:
Claw beam number 6: CCW end:
Claw beam number 7: CW end:
Claw beam number 7: CCW end:
Claw beam number 8: CW end:
Claw beam number 8: CCW end:
Claw beam number 9: CW end:
Claw beam number 9: CCW end:
Claw beam number 10: CW end:
Claw beam number 10: CCW end:
Claw beam number 11: CW end:
Claw beam number 11: CCW end:
Sum: CW end:
Sum: CCW end:

Do a check of
the bolts for the end-stop (brass or aluminium piece) for
the radial slide plates.
Yaw lubrication system: Manually lubricate the yaw sliding surface.
Service crane
Examine the service crane.
High voltage

Do an inspection of
the transformer,
the transformer room, and the HV
switchgear.
Service lift and climb assistance

Do a check of
the service lift and the climb assistance according to the
supplier’s user manual.
Tower

To do a visual
inspection of
the middle section liquid damper (optional):

Do a visual
inspection of
the liquid level
in the barrels.

Do a visual
inspection of the barrels for liquid leakage.

Do a visual
inspection of
the mechanical components of
the damper
units and wires.

++06 UPS cabinet: Do a check of the settings of
the timers and the
temperature control devices according to the relay setting document.
See 0061-1789 ’Relay setting for V100/V110 2,2 MW VCS/VCSS Mk

Do a check of
the MCBs.
Visually examine the UPS battery cartridges and the UPS battery packs
for leakage.

To do a test of
the UPS batteries: Do a test of
the UPS batteries.

Replace the UPS batteries,
if necessary. Date (as a comment)

Replace the UPS,
if necessary. Date (as a comment).

Do a check of
the heating elements.
Examine the fan.

Do a check of
the air filters in the UPS cabinet.
++01 Ground control cabinet: Do a test of all processor backup

batteries in all
the cabinets.

Examine if
the heating elements are activated.
RCBOs and RCCBs.
Do a check of the contactor switching counter for contactors
-695-02-Q1 and -695-04-Q1 for number of switching.
Number of switching:
++51 Light box: Examine the RCCB ++51-640-02-03-F1 inside the
++51 light system control panel.
Visually examine the 12 V batteries for leakage.

Examine the function of
the emergency light and the 12 V batteries.

Do a check of
the air filter in the light box cabinet.
Finish work

Clean the cabinets,
the covers, and the other surfaces for grease spots
and finger marks.
Clean grease from the checker plates and the other surfaces.
Remove the collected grease from the yaw top teeth.
Clean the tower basement and tower from inside.
